characters.alibi: Claims to have been at home, working on his computer, all evening. No witnesses.
characters.description: A somewhat reclusive tech entrepreneur. He's known for his innovative software and his intense work ethic. He appears nervous and distracted.
characters.name: Elias Thorne
characters.personality: Intelligent, withdrawn, and highly ambitious. Used to be friends with the victim a long time ago.

characters.alibi: Confirmed attendance at a literary event downtown. Several witnesses.
characters.description: A sharp-tongued literary agent with a reputation for discovering new talent. Dresses impeccably and carries herself with unwavering confidence.
characters.name: Vivienne Sterling
characters.personality: Ambitious, driven, and fiercely protective of her clients. Recently started working with Elias Thorne.

characters.alibi: Was at a concert with friends. They corroborate his story.
characters.description: A struggling musician, often performing at local venues. Appears laid-back, but shows flashes of anger when questioned about his music.
characters.name: Jake Riley
characters.personality: Passionate, anxious, and resentful of those more successful than him. He was once in a band with the victim back in school.

characters.description: A rising star in the tech world, known for his charm and ability to secure funding.
characters.name: Marcus Bellweather
characters.personality: Ambitious, charismatic, and well-liked. However, he had a tendency to burn bridges.

characters.alibi: Claims to have been at a yoga retreat out of town.
characters.description: A social media influencer with a large following. Seems more concerned with her online image than with providing helpful information.
characters.name: Chloe Vance
characters.personality: Superficial, image-conscious, and always seeking the next big trend. She had publicly endorsed Marcus's latest product.

characters.alibi: She works nights and was on shift
characters.description: A night security guard at the tech firm where Marcus worked. Observant and detail-oriented. Tends to keep to herself.
characters.name: Sarah Chen
characters.personality: Quiet, diligent, and trustworthy. She takes her job seriously and is dedicated to it.

characters.alibi: Was at home caring for his sick mother.
characters.description: Marcus’s older brother, a former programmer who left the tech world to care for his family. Bitter about Marcus’s success.
characters.name: David Bellweather
characters.personality: Resentful, burdened, and feels overlooked. He believes his brother stole his code.

characters.alibi: She was out of the country.
characters.description: Marcus’s ex-girlfriend, a successful lawyer with a high-powered firm. She seemed nonchalant about his death.
characters.name: Rachel Hayes
characters.personality: Driven, calculating, and always in control. She and Marcus had an acrimonious breakup.

characters.alibi: She works in Marcus’s house and was at home on the night in question.
characters.description: A longtime employee of Marcus' and is dedicated to doing the best job she can for his sake.
characters.name: Annie Smith
characters.personality: Friendly, helpful, and has a lot of personal pride in doing a good job.

characters.description: A mysterious hacker known for leaking sensitive information. Their motives are always unclear.
characters.name: ZeroDay
characters.personality: Anonymous, unpredictable, and driven by their own sense of justice.

clues.description: Security camera footage shows Elias Thorne entering Marcus's office building shortly before the estimated time of death.
clues.name: Security Camera Footage

clues.description: A draft contract found in Vivienne Sterling's office indicates Marcus was about to leave Elias's company to start his own.
clues.name: Unsigned Contract Draft

clues.description: Jake Riley's guitar pick, with his initials, was found near the victim's body.
clues.name: Guitar Pick

clues.description: Marcus sent an email to Elias threatening to expose his unethical business practices if he didn't receive a larger share of the profits.
clues.name: Incriminating Email

clues.description: A threatening note was found in Elias's office, presumably sent by Marcus, demanding a large sum of money.
clues.name: Threatening Note

clues.description: Vivienne states that she believed Marcus was an asset to her client Mr Thorne.
clues.name: Vivienne's Statement

clues.description: Jake claims he hadn't seen Marcus in years and was shocked to hear about his death.
clues.name: Jake's Statement

clues.description: Chloe posted a promotional video for Marcus's product the day before his death, but has since deleted it.
clues.name: Deleted Social Media Post

clues.description: The security log shows that the alarm system was disarmed shortly before the murder and re-armed afterward.
clues.name: Alarm System Log

clues.description: David claims he loved his brother and would never hurt him, despite their past disagreements.
clues.name: David's Statement

clues.description: Rachel states that she had moved on from her relationship with Marcus and was not involved in his business dealings.
clues.name: Rachel's Statement

clues.description: Annie claims that Marcus was very careful about his health and never took sleeping pills.
clues.name: Annie's Statement

clues.description: A half-empty bottle of sleeping pills was found in Marcus’s desk drawer. Analysis shows they were a strong prescription not prescribed to him.
clues.name: Sleeping Pills

clues.description: A forensic report indicates that Marcus died from an overdose of sleeping pills, possibly mixed with alcohol. There were signs of a struggle.
clues.name: Forensic Report

clues.description: Marcus's bank records show a series of large withdrawals in the weeks leading up to his death.
clues.name: Bank Records

clues.description: A highly encrypted file is missing from Marcus's computer. Its contents are unknown, but it was last accessed the day of his death.
clues.name: Missing Encrypted File

clues.description: Data leaked online reveals that Marcus was involved in a scandal involving stolen intellectual property.
clues.name: Leaked Data

locations.description: A modern office space with glass walls and sleek furniture. The victim's desk is cluttered with papers and gadgets.
locations.name: Marcus's Office

locations.description: A high-tech office filled with computer screens and coding books. The atmosphere is tense and sterile.
locations.name: Elias's Office

locations.description: An upscale office decorated with book covers and literary awards. Organized and professional.
locations.name: Vivienne's Office

locations.description: A dimly lit, cramped venue with a small stage and worn-out furniture. The air smells of stale beer and cigarettes.
locations.name: Jake's Venue

locations.description: A modest, cluttered home filled with medical equipment and family photos. The atmosphere is heavy with resentment.
locations.name: David's Home

locations.description: A hidden online forum where ZeroDay posts their leaks. Access is restricted to a select few.
locations.name: ZeroDay's Online Forum

mystery.description: Marcus Bellweather, a rising star in the tech world, is found dead in his office from an apparent overdose. Was it suicide, or something more sinister?
mystery.title: Silicon Betrayal

solution.method: Elias, fearing Marcus would expose his unethical dealings and take the stolen IPO code with him, visited Marcus's office and used a fake security code he had previously obtained. He then mixed a large dose of sleeping pills into Marcus' drink, staging the scene to look like a suicide or accidental overdose. He then used access to leak data online, and tried to cover his tracks.
solution.motive: Elias wanted to prevent Marcus from starting his own company, exposing Elias's unethical business practices, and revealing Elias has stolen code.
